required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NTLA-2002 in Adults With Hereditary Angioedema (HAE)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1/2 Study to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of NTLA-2002 in Adults With Hereditary Angioedema (HAE)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted to evaluate the safety, tolerability, activity, pharmacokinetics, and pharmacodynamics of NTLA-2002 in adults with Hereditary Angioedema (HAE).

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of NTLA-2002 as determined by adverse events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From NTLA-2002 infusion up to week 104 post-infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Estimated efficacy as determined by measurement of change from baseline in HAE attack rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: From study drug infusion up to week 104 post-infusion, primary observation period change in attack rate 16 weeks post-infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the efficacy of NTLA-2002 as determined by HAE attack rate (Weeks 1-16, Weeks 5-16
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From NTLA-2002 infusion up to week 104 post-infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in total plasma kallikrein protein level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From NTLA-2002 infusion up to week 104 post-infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma and urine concentrations for DMG-PEG2k, LP000001, Cas9 mRNA, and sgRNA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From NTLA-2002 infusion up to week 104 post-infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of NTLA-2002 as determined by AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study drug infusion up to week 104 post-infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in HAE attack rate (Weeks 5-16)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study drug infusion up to week 104 post-infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in number of HAE attacks requiring acute therapy (Weeks 1-16, Weeks 5-16)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study drug infusion up to week 16 post-infusion

arm_group.description: Participants, assigned to one of 3 dose-escalation cohorts, will receive a single dose of NTLA-2002 on Day 1 and will then be followed for up to 24 months ; primary observation period is 16 weeks

Participants, randomized to NTLA-2002 will be assigned to one of 2 dose levels, will receive a single dose of NTLA-2002 on Day 1 and will then be followed for up to 24 months; primary observation period is 16 weeks

Participants randomized to placebo will be assigned to a matching IV normal saline administration on day 1 and will then be followed for up to 24 months Primary observation period = 16 weeks (~4 months)

intervention.description: CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing system delivered by LNP for IV administration
The administration of IV normal saline

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age >18 years
2. Diagnosis of HAE Types I or II
3. Ability to provide evidence of HAE attacks to meet the screening requirement
4. Subjects must have access to, and the ability to use, â‰¥ 1 acute medication(s) to treat angioedema attacks.
5. Adequate chemistry and hematology measures at screening
6. Subjects must agree not to participate in another interventional study for the duration of this trial.
7. Subjects must be capable of providing signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Concurrent diagnosis of any other type of recurrent angioedema
2. Subjects who have known negative reaction or hypersensitivity to any lipid nanoparticles (LNP) component.
3. Any condition that, in the Investigator's opinion, could adversely affect the safety of the subject.
4. Unwilling to comply with study procedures.
